Principal InvestigatorMartin Pollak, PhDBeth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, Boston, MA, USA

Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Molecular Genetic Analysis of Inherited Kidney Dysfunction
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Molecular genetic analysis of inherited kidney dysfunction
Configuration.Description: Samples were chosen for sequencing from a set of probands from pedigrees with apparently inherited forms of focal segmental glomerulosclerosis (FSGS). Several genes have been identified which when mutated cause FSGS under both recessive and dominant inheritance patterns. These known genes are estimated to explain less than 50% of inherited FSGS. We chose samples from individuals in which previous analyses of known disease genes failed to identify likely disease-causing mutations.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Inclusion - Cases: FSGS or steroid-resistant nephritic syndrome.

Exclusion: Clear secondary causes of kidney disease. No age exclusions.

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: Data Use Limitations: 1) Restricted to study of kidney diseases; 2) No commercial use allowed; 3) Sampels will only be provided from subjects who agreed to sharing with other investigators.
